verses.kjv: And David numbered the people that were with him, and set captains of thousands and captains of hundreds over them.
verses.ct: David organized the troops who were with him, appointing commanders over groups of 1,000 and commanders over groups of 100.

verses.kjv: And David sent forth a third part of the people under the hand of Joab, and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab’s brother, and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite. And the king said unto the people, I will surely go forth with you myself also.
verses.ct: David divided the army into 3 divisions: one third under Joab's command, one third under Abishai son of Zeruiah (Joab's brother), and one third under Ittai the Gittite. The king told the troops, "I will definitely march out with you myself."

verses.kjv: But the people answered, Thou shalt not go forth: for if we flee away, they will not care for us; neither if half of us die, will they care for us: but now thou art worth ten thousand of us: therefore now it is better that thou succour us out of the city.
verses.ct: But the troops objected, "You must not come out with us. If we have to retreat, the enemy won't care about us. Even if half of us are killed, they won't care. But you are worth 10,000 of us. It would be better for you to stay in the city and send us reinforcements from there."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto them, What seemeth you best I will do. And the king stood by the gate side, and all the people came out by hundreds and by thousands.
verses.ct: The king replied, "I'll do whatever you think is best." So the king stood beside the gate as all the troops marched out in units of 100s and 1,000s.

verses.kjv: And the king commanded Joab and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Deal gently for my sake with the young man, even with Absalom. And all the people heard when the king gave all the captains charge concerning Absalom.
verses.ct: The king gave orders to Joab, Abishai, and Ittai: "For my sake, be gentle with the young man Absalom." All the troops heard the king give this command to every officer regarding Absalom.

verses.kjv: So the people went out into the field against Israel: and the battle was in the wood of Ephraim;
verses.ct: The army marched out to the field to fight against Israel, and the battle took place in the forest of Ephraim.

verses.kjv: Where the people of Israel were slain before the servants of David, and there was there a great slaughter that day of twenty thousand men.
verses.ct: The Israelite forces were defeated there by David's soldiers, and the casualties that day were enormous — 20,000 men fell.

verses.kjv: For the battle was there scattered over the face of all the country: and the wood devoured more people that day than the sword devoured.
verses.ct: The fighting spread across the entire countryside, and the forest claimed more lives that day than the sword did.

verses.kjv: And Absalom met the servants of David. And Absalom rode upon a mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went away.
verses.ct: Absalom happened to run into David's soldiers. He was riding a mule, and as the mule passed under the thick branches of a large oak tree, Absalom's head got caught in the oak. He was left hanging between heaven and earth as the mule kept going without him.

verses.kjv: And a certain man saw it, and told Joab, and said, Behold, I saw Absalom hanged in an oak.
verses.ct: One of the soldiers saw this and reported to Joab, "I just saw Absalom hanging in an oak tree!"

verses.kjv: And Joab said unto the man that told him, And, behold, thou sawest him, and why didst thou not smite him there to the ground? and I would have given thee ten shekels of silver, and a girdle.
verses.ct: Joab said to the man who told him, "You saw him? Why didn't you strike him down right there? I would have given you 10 pieces of silver and a belt!"

verses.kjv: And the man said unto Joab, Though I should receive a thousand shekels of silver in mine hand, yet would I not put forth mine hand against the king’s son: for in our hearing the king charged thee and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Beware that none touch the young man Absalom.
verses.ct: The man replied to Joab, "Even if you placed 1,000 pieces of silver in my hands, I would not raise a hand against the king's son. We all heard the king command you, Abishai, and Ittai, 'Make sure no one harms the young man Absalom.'"

verses.kjv: Otherwise I should have wrought falsehood against mine own life: for there is no matter hid from the king, and thou thyself wouldest have set thyself against me.
verses.ct: "If I had risked doing it, I would have been putting my own life in danger — nothing stays hidden from the king — and you yourself would have turned against me."

verses.kjv: Then said Joab, I may not tarry thus with thee. And he took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he was yet alive in the midst of the oak.
verses.ct: Joab said, "I'm not going to waste any more time with you." He grabbed 3 javelins and drove them into Absalom's chest while Absalom was still alive, hanging in the oak tree.

verses.kjv: And ten young men that bare Joab’s armour compassed about and smote Absalom, and slew him.
verses.ct: Then 10 young men who served as Joab's armor bearers surrounded Absalom, struck him, and finished him off.

verses.kjv: And Joab blew the trumpet, and the people returned from pursuing after Israel: for Joab held back the people.
verses.ct: Joab sounded the trumpet, and the troops stopped chasing the Israelites, because Joab called them back.

verses.kjv: And they took Absalom, and cast him into a great pit in the wood, and laid a very great heap of stones upon him: and all Israel fled every one to his tent.
verses.ct: They took Absalom's body and threw it into a deep pit in the forest, then piled a huge mound of stones over it. Meanwhile, all the Israelites scattered and fled to their homes.

verses.kjv: Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself a pillar, which is in the king’s dale: for he said, I have no son to keep my name in remembrance: and he called the pillar after his own name: and it is called unto this day, Absalom’s place.
verses.ct: During his lifetime, Absalom had set up a stone monument for himself in the King's Valley, because he said, "I have no son to carry on my name." He named the monument after himself, and to this day it is still called Absalom's Monument.

verses.kjv: Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok, Let me now run, and bear the king tidings, how that the LORD hath avenged him of his enemies.
verses.ct: Then Ahimaaz son of Zadok said, "Let me run and bring the king the news that the LORD has given him justice against his enemies."

verses.kjv: And Joab said unto him, Thou shalt not bear tidings this day, but thou shalt bear tidings another day: but this day thou shalt bear no tidings, because the king’s son is dead.
verses.ct: But Joab told him, "You are not the one to carry the news today. You can carry news some other day, but not today, because the king's son is dead."

verses.kjv: Then said Joab to Cushi, Go tell the king what thou hast seen. And Cushi bowed himself unto Joab, and ran.
verses.ct: Then Joab told a Cushite messenger, "Go report to the king what you have seen." The Cushite bowed to Joab and took off running.

verses.kjv: Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok yet again to Joab, But howsoever, let me, I pray thee, also run after Cushi. And Joab said, Wherefore wilt thou run, my son, seeing that thou hast no tidings ready?
verses.ct: But Ahimaaz son of Zadok pressed Joab again, "No matter what happens, please let me also run after the Cushite." Joab asked, "Why would you want to run, my son? You don't even have any real news to deliver."

verses.kjv: But howsoever, said he, let me run. And he said unto him, Run. Then Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and overran Cushi.
verses.ct: "Regardless," he insisted, "let me run." So Joab told him, "Then run." Ahimaaz took the route through the Jordan Valley plain and outran the Cushite.

verses.kjv: And David sat between the two gates: and the watchman went up to the roof over the gate unto the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold a man running alone.
verses.ct: David was sitting between the inner and outer gates. The watchman climbed up to the roof above the gate along the wall, looked out, and spotted a man running alone.

verses.kjv: And the watchman cried, and told the king. And the king said, If he be alone, there is tidings in his mouth. And he came apace, and drew near.
verses.ct: The watchman called out and reported it to the king. The king said, "If he's alone, he's bringing news." The runner kept getting closer.

verses.kjv: And the watchman saw another man running: and the watchman called unto the porter, and said, Behold another man running alone. And the king said, He also bringeth tidings.
verses.ct: Then the watchman spotted a second man running. He called down to the gatekeeper, "There's another man running alone!" The king said, "He's bringing news too."

verses.kjv: And the watchman said, Me thinketh the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. And the king said, He is a good man, and cometh with good tidings.
verses.ct: The watchman said, "The way the first one runs looks like the stride of Ahimaaz son of Zadok." The king said, "He's a good man — he must be coming with good news."

verses.kjv: And Ahimaaz called, and said unto the king, All is well. And he fell down to the earth upon his face before the king, and said, Blessed be the LORD thy God, which hath delivered up the men that lifted up their hand against my lord the king.
verses.ct: Ahimaaz called out to the king, "Everything is well!" Then he bowed down with his face to the ground before the king and said, "Praise the LORD your God, who has handed over the men who raised their hands against my lord the king!"

verses.kjv: And the king said, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Ahimaaz answered, When Joab sent the king’s servant, and me thy servant, I saw a great tumult, but I knew not what it was.
verses.ct: The king asked, "Is the young man Absalom safe?" Ahimaaz answered, "When Joab sent your servant and me, I noticed a big commotion, but I didn't find out what it was about."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto him, Turn aside, and stand here. And he turned aside, and stood still.
verses.ct: The king told him, "Step aside and wait here." So he moved aside and stood there.

verses.kjv: And, behold, Cushi came; and Cushi said, Tidings, my lord the king: for the LORD hath avenged thee this day of all them that rose up against thee.
verses.ct: Then the Cushite arrived and said, "I have news for my lord the king! Today the LORD has given you justice against everyone who rebelled against you."

verses.kjv: And the king said unto Cushi, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Cushi answered, The enemies of my lord the king, and all that rise against thee to do thee hurt, be as that young man is.
verses.ct: The king asked the Cushite, "Is the young man Absalom safe?" The Cushite answered, "May all the enemies of my lord the king, and everyone who rises up to harm you, end up like that young man."

verses.kjv: And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept: and as he went, thus he said, O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! would God I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son!
verses.ct: The king was overcome with grief. He went up to the room above the gate and wept. As he walked, he kept saying, "My son Absalom! My son, my son Absalom! If only I had died instead of you — Absalom, my son, my son!"
